title-group.article-title: Security Market Anticipation of Consumer Preference Shifts: The Case of Automotive Recalls

abstract.p: This study presents an empirical analysis of the financial impact of automotive recall announcements on the equity holders of the firm T s domestic and foreign competitors. Because earlier research has documented both sales increases and decreases for competitive models following automotive recalls (depending upon the classification and time period of the announcement), the study was designed specifically to determine the markets ability to discriminate at the time of announcement between nearly identical recall events that later were determined to have resulted in differential ex post realizations.
